intro: Piper carpinifolium, commonly known as the mountain pepper or wild pepper, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped, glossy leaves. Its small greenish-yellow flowers are followed by small, peppery fruits that are used in local cuisines. The plant is valued for its aromatic leaves and has traditional medicinal uses in some indigenous communities.
